intro: Nephrodium larutense, commonly known as the Larut kidney fern, is a rare and endemic fern species found in the Larut region of Malaysia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive kidney-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth. Its fronds are usually dark green and have a leathery texture, with a complex venation pattern. Nephrodium larutense plays an important role in the local ecosystem, contributing to biodiversity and soil stability.
